attributes.action: Equal reproductive choice: let men relinquish parental rights & costs pre-birth.
attributes.additional_details: Current law gives pregnant people full control over whether a pregnancy continues, which is ethically correct, but men have no equivalent legal choice. A man can become a father without his consent and be forced to pay child support for 18 years, even if he never wanted a child or had no say in the outcome. This imbalance is unfair and outdated. The law should allow men a clear, pre-birth opt-out so responsibility matches choice, while abortion decisions remain solely with the pregnant person.
attributes.background: Pass a law letting men sign a binding pre-birth opt-out that ends all parental rights and child maintenance. A woman can become pregnant and choose to keep or abort without the man's consent, yet men can still be forced to pay for 18 years. Make it fair.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

End men’s financial responsibilities in cases of deceptive conception
